result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley Arthur Kuehn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving Stolen Property (>$2500-$5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(bf).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Pepin County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
AMENDED 08-25-2020:  Order 30 days conditional jail and stay it if pay $500.00 towards restitution by 11-01-2020.  If not paid, report to the Pepin County Jail on 11-01-2020 @ 5:00 p.m.  Probation 
extended for 1 year from 11-13-2021.  During any months payments of $100.00 towards restitution and $50.00 court ordered obligations have not been paid, order 10 days in the Pepin County Jail starting the 10th of the month.  All obligations to be paid in full by 10-01-2021 or order 30 days in the Pepin County Jail commencing 11-01-2021 @ 5:00 p.m. as a condition of probation.

miscConds.notes:
Pay Restitution according to a schedule set forth by Probation & Parole.
Restitution of $1000.00 in 2016CF45 is joint & several.
Restitution of $952.02 in 2017CM08 DRI.
Restitution of $380.00 in 2016CM39 DRI.
Restitution of $17.40 in 2017CM19 DRI.
Court has no objection to early discharge from probation if all court ordered obligations are paid in full.
Pay costs/surcharges according to a schedule set forth by Probation & Parole

Provide a DNA sample;
Comply with any assessment or counseling set up by Probation & Parole.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley Arthur Kuehn

records.addlTxt: NOH returned undeliverable

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: 12:43 PM Defendant Bradley Arthur Kuehn appeared by video means without counsel.  Prosecuting Atty Jon D. Seifert appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  THe Court received a letter from the DOC indicated a possible erroneous credit.  Court previously ordered 252 days credit on the JOC on 7/20/21 and the department indicated they felt there may be more credit due.  Mr. Seifert reviewed the materials provided by the DOC and revocation order and warrant and the time for credit.  State unable to come up with their 344 days credit.  Think 328 looks right and think he has more that the 252 days original set in the JOC.  Court finds 328 days.  No objection by Mr. Kuehn to the 328 days credit.  No objection by the State.  Court not sure how they came up with the 344.  Court orders 328 credit.  If you or someone else can show more, would be happy to listen.  Mr. Kuehn believes his attorney had wrong calculation.  Court orders 328 days credit.
Hearing on April 5, 2022 at 12:45 pm.
Notice of Intent to Certify Debt to WI DOR mailed to defendant ret'd to sender...
Letters from DOC staff to Court regarding sentence credit
Notice of Intent to Certify Debt to the Wisconsin Department of Revenue
DOC - Notice of Status Change Slip - Revoked - Sentenced to Prison
NEJ mailed to victim ret'd undeliverable
Memos to the court from DOC Re: Restitution

08:34 AM Defendant Bradley Arthur Kuehn appeared by zoom technology by video means without counsel from the Pepin County Jail. DOC Agent Theis appeared by video means. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  The Court has been contacted by the PD office and you are eligible but they have not been able to find someone to represent you.  Mr. Kuehn wishes to proceed without an attorney.  Court advises of constitutional right of attorney.  Mr. Kuehn understands.  Court advises of maximum penalties of the charge.  Mr. Kuehn wishes to proceed and represent himself.  No objection by the State.  Court will proceed on the Pepin County Case only, not the Buffalo County Case.  Mr. Kuehn confirms receipt of the Revocation Order & Warrant with correction to time served and believe Mr. Theis was updated with that otherwise no objection.  Mr. Theis agrees and will prepare a memo to the Court if needed.  State's sentencing arguments and State in agreement with recommendation of 12 months incarceration in 16CF45 and interested to hear the calculation of time served as was unaware of any Menomonie sanction and not listed in the Revocation Report.  State ended up with 192 jail credit which includes time served on original sentence and don't have a firm # of jail credit.  If Agent Theis says all 60 were to apply to this case then 252.  If gets credit for good time that would be 274 with 22 days left to serve on this sentence.  Imagine he will be held on Buffalo County matter until that hearing.  Agent Theis forgot about the 60 days and not sure if for Pepin County or Buffalo County and could submit Memo to the Court.  Mr. Kuehn doesn't have the # of days of credit and would ask that court add 1 day to get a year and a day to get into the  program through Buffalo County sentence.  Agent Theis not opposed.  On 4/11/19 Mr. Theis was brought before the court for jail hold which believe is what he is referring to.  Court will go along with suggestion.  Court confirms Mr. Kuehn wishes to go ahead with his sentence.  He wishes.  Total length of sentence for count 1 is 3 years 1 month but will be a year a day as requested, addt'l term of confinement will be 1 year, 1 day and time serve on ES will be 2 years 0 months. Court reads condition of ES.  Find not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program but eligible for Substance Abuse Program and if qualifies, be immediately released to ES. Court grants judgment to victim in the amount of $1349.42.  $752.94 judgment granted to the county for court costs.  Sentence is 1 year 1 day confinement.  Written Explanation doesn't have days on it so wrote it in.  252 days credit for moment until receive Agent Theis' memo then DA to respond and Mr. Kuehn to get a copy if object, schedule a hearing.  Agent Theis to send memo of breakdown of judgment amounts owing to the victims.  Court advises Mr. Kuehn of appeal rights.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 19, 2021 at 08:30 am.
Letter from DOC with Sentencing After Revocation Packet and Notice of Sentencing After Revocation on 7/19/21 at 8:30 am
Rec'd confirmation from DOC Mr. Kuehn made his payment towards restitution and working on the $50
Received confirmation from DOC Mr. Kuehn has paid his January payment and February payment on 2/5/2021.
Rec'd confirmation from DOC Mr. Kuehn paid $500 by November and $100 for December but has not made the $50 addt'l payment.  Agent will be in contact with him.

09:00 AM  Recorded from Buffalo County.  Defendant Bradley Arthur Kuehn appeared by phone means. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  DOC Agent Theis appeared by phone means.  Mr. Kuehn due to discharged November 2020 and significant unpaid restitution of $2199.52 and $752.94 court ordered obligations.  Mr. Kuehn informs the court he plans getting on a payment plan with agent and pay $500 by November.  State requests restitution be paid prior to discharge or significant jail penalty.  DOC Agent proposes Mr. Kuehn pay $500 by November to avoid 30-60 day jail and extend for 1 year to get the remaining balance paid.  Mr. Kuehn agrees to DOC proposal.  Court set 30 day conditional jail ordered but stay it if pay $500 restitution by November 1.  If not paid, you will report to the PCJ on 11/1 @ 5:00 p.m. for 30 days.  Your probation will be extended for 1 year commencing 11-13-2020 and discharge 11-13-2021.  During any months $100 towards restitution and $50 toward CO obligations have not been paid, order 10 days in the PCJ starting the 10th of the month; all obligations to be paid by 10/1/21 or sit 30 days jail as of 10/1 as condition of probation.
Probation review hearing on August 25, 2020 at 09:00 am.
DOC Notice of CO Financial Obligation - Unpaid restitution, court obs.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Bradley Arthur Kuehn in court with attorney Melissa M. Petersen.  Defendant Bradley Arthur Kuehn in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State informs court of agreement, defendant will plead guilty or no contest to count 1 in 16CF45, other cases, 17CM08, 16CM39, 17CM19 will be DRI for restitution on all cases of $2349.42; agreement State argue 2 years probation, 6 months jail, 2 days credit.  Restitution of $1000 joint & several in 16CF45.  Court advises defendant of elements/max. penalties of charge.  Defendant enters plea of no contest.  PLQ/W0RF filed with court and court reviewed with the defendant.  Court advises defendant of felony prohibitions and constitutional rights.  Court finds waiver of constitutional rights and plea done K&V, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty.  State confirms complied with victim notification requirements and informs there are no victim impact statements.  States closing statement.  Atty Petersen closing statement and requests early discharge if pay the restitution within 1 year.  Defendant addresses the court.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 2 years probation and if gets everything paid off has no objection to early release; condition of probation:  Pay restitution of $2349.42, allocate $1000 restitution in 16CF45 as joint & several; 6 months in the PCJ with huber for employment, assessment or treatment; 2 days credit; pay costs of case; provide a DNA sample; comply with any assessment or counseling set up by P&P; advised of appeal rights.
To Transport

Jury Trial Scheduling Order:
1.  Trial of this matter is set for jury trial on October 30, 2017.  Time allowed for trial is one day.
2.  The District Attorney will send the Defense Atty their settlement offer prior to the FPT.
3.  The Defense Atty shall review the DA's settlement offer with his/her client prior to the FPT.
4.  A FPT is set for October 9, 2017 at 2:00 p.m.
5.  The Defense Atty, the Defendant, and the District Atty shall all personally appear at the FPT.
For complete Order see file.

Defendant Bradley Arthur Kuehn in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant warrants issued for FTA on 5/22/17.  State notes defendant lengthy criminal history, previously failed to appear and requests $1000 cash bond.  Defendant informs he's been in contact with the PD office and spoke with Mr. Rivard the morning of his court date, appeared for court at 4:00 p.m. and spoke with P.S. who informed him to contact his atty.  Off record for Clerk to confirm if what defendant is saying is accurate.  On record.  Mr. Kuehn called late in the day, unsure if date is date of court.  Court sets $1000 signature bond and defendant to return to court on 6/6 at 2:30 p.m.  Mr. Kuehn to contact Mr. Rivard.  Mr. Kuehn indicates Lisa, unsure of last name, was reassigned to his case.  Court has no information to that effect but should talk to his attorney.
Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant f/t/a.  Warrant requested by the State & authorized by the court.

Defendant Bradley Arthur Kuehn in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court inquires of defendant's address?  N1101 Sandridge Rd, Pepin.  Defendant wishes to waive right to PH and files WOPH form with court.  Court reviews defendant's right to PH, finds his WOPH done K&V, binds over.  NGP entered in 17CM08.  Any conditions of bond previously set are cont'd.  Referred to scheduling clerk for Arraignment in felony case and STC on misdemeanor matters.  Court informs defendant had 3 warrants, and today paid $500; 16FO71 was paid in full, applied $193.50 in 16FO72 with balance of $133.00 and in 16FO75 owes $326.00.  Court quashed the warrant in 16FO71, other warrants still active.  Defendant informs he will pay in full by his next court date in criminal matters.  Court quashes warrants in 16FO72 and 16FO75 and will review to determine paid by next hearing.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 6, 2017 at 09:15 am.
